Full review with updating of bleep numbers for contacting staff. Addition to point 5.0 to include efficient running of theatres

data.text: The Anaesthetic and Theatre Directorate provide the Maternity Service with the specialist Theatre staff who are required to support the department for elective and emergency cases.
The theatre service ensures that the staff are available to support this service.
The theatre department is there to support the following.
The multi-disciplinary team responsible for maternal women and other acute clinical events that require actual or potential surgical intervention.
The theatre service provides theatre cover in hours, out of hours for elective and emergency activity.
Estimated elective caesarean sections are 850 cases per year.
Estimated emergency deliveries requiring surgical intervention 2,000 per year.
Anaesthetic team to include Consultant anaesthetist and other, either SHO or SPR or trust grade doctor (Anaesthetics).
1 midwife (Monday to Friday for the elective Caesarean section lists)
(Recommended skilled support for any elective or emergency operative procedure, according to the recommendation from the AFPP Appendix 1)
3.4.1 The service is provided 7 days a week, 24 hours a day.
3.4.2 Hours of service are as follows:
08:30 - 13:00 hours: 5 days a week for all elective caesarean sections.
13:00 - 08:30 hours the following day emergency covers for all emergencies out of hours. All other times are provided as emergency cover.
Any patient that may present as an emergency to the trauma theatre service
Emergency maternity surgical activity requiring maternity theatre services
All patients who require surgical intervention will access the service as directed in the above flow chart. The process for emergency intervention remains the same both in hours and out of hours.
4.2.1 The decision to open a second obstetric theatre within the Maternity Department must be taken between the Consultant Obstetrician and Consultant Anaesthetist.

4.2.2 The main reason to open a second theatre is to provide emergency care for all emergency cases that occur during the elective list (08:30 to 13.00) as two teams should be available to support this activity during these hours.

4.2.3 For Grade 1 ( as soon as possible not to exceed  minutes) and Grade 2 (not to exceed  minutes) emergency caesarean sections that cannot be delayed in coming to theatre and in conjunction with the decision made by the Consultant Obstetrician and Anaesthetists in charge of the list. Other cases that may come to the second theatre are repair of perineal tear, instrumental deliveries, retained placenta.

4.3.1 Contact the Senior Sister via bleep number #6555 3033 to initiate the opening of a second theatre team for obstetric Emergency. The Senior Sister is responsible for organising the team to open a second theatre.
4.3.2 The emergency maternity bleep number #6555 3033 is to be used only in emergencies.
4.3.3 In emergencies if team require further help contact Main Theatre co-ordinator on #6555 2643.

4.3.3 The implications of emergency provision and safe provision of care in other areas must be taken into consideration when calling staff from elsewhere in the theatre department. Also by having two maternity theatres working there is no further emergency capacity for any other obstetric emergencies during that time.
4.3.4 All cases must be recorded under theatre 2 maternity on Theatre Man (computerised theatre operating system) and in the operating register provided to allow audit of the theatre use.
4.3.5 Elective sections cannot be performed after 18:00 (so should not be sent for after
17.15) or at weekends without an extra team either in the department or on standby. This needs to be discussed with either the Service Manager of Theatre Matron.
Elective maternity P atient flow  surgical activity
Patient is booked via  Patient  to  ward  post Consultant  delivery
Patient  to  recovery Theatre list is  post delivery
the atre time on one of  Patient  admitted  to  Seen  by  Obstetrician the elective sessions  ward. Anaesthetic  and midwife

All elective patients are seen by the Consultant responsible for their care and a decision is made if the patient requires a Caesarean Section. Once the decision is made the patient will be booked for their operation. The patient will be seen preoperatively by the Consultant Anaesthetist and the obstetrician who will be performing the surgery. A midwife will be allocated the patients care. The patient will then go to theatre.
Post surgery she will be cared for in the recovery area and mother and baby will be cared for by the midwife and returned to the post-operative ward.
Ensuring efficient use of maternity theatres:

08:30 team brief with consultant anaesthetist and obstetrician responsible for the list plus midwifery and theatre staff. Plan for order of the list, fasting times for patients; aim to have first patient in theatre by 9am or earlier.
To ensure smooth running of the list all team members to be present in theatre for the spinal block (including obstetric consultant) and to remain in theatre until the caesarean has been completed.

Training by anaesthetic and obstetric teams only appropriate on lists with two or less booked caesarean sections. Junior medical staff may be trained on lists with more than two caesareans only if it is not causing a delay to the list and the consultant is directly supervising.

If labour ward activity allows (by confirmation with ‘hot week' consultant and labour ward co-ordinator) both maternity theatres may be used to increase list turnover. A second elective patient can be brought to theatre 2, checked in, monitoring applied and cannulated. The spinal block will not start until the skin is sutured on the patient in the other theatre. This must be done with the agreement of the midwife or midwives assigned to the list. This plan should be discussed at the morning team brief.

The elective list will run in an uninterrupted fashion. It will only stop only if requested by the hot week consultant or labour ward co-ordinator. This applies even if an emergency case is occupying one theatre. It is the responsibility of the hot week consultant to inform the theatre team if they cannot continue the list due to labour ward activity. The theatre team do not need to check with labour ward before sending for an elective case.
Elective caesarean patients are expected to spend no longer than 30 minutes in recovery unless there are complications.
09:00 - 13:00 Elective and emergency service (2 theatre teams available) 13:30 - 17:30 Emergencies
After 17:30 (out of hours) bleep number for emergency surgery is #6555 3033.
Code red escalation for maternity theatres #6555 3033; held by senior staff during normal operating hours for the purpose of communicating the operational
aspect of opening the nd obstetric theatre.
The staffing will meet the standard set by the AFPP. (See appendix 1.)
The operating theatre will provide essential equipment necessary for the elective
and emergency caesarean sections and all procedures performed in the obstetric theatre.
Provides sterile instrumentation for operative procedures (controlled by maternity theatres)
Provided through pharmacy, controlled by maternity theatres and pharmacy
Provided by contract linen service, controlled by maternity dept
Provided by the procurement dept, controlled by maternity theatres
Essential to support this service are as follows.
Provides an surgical team for all emergencies  hours a day, 7 days a week
Provide a  hour cover to all Theatres
Provides the service required to access blood results and products
Provide the required service for all birthing mothers
Provide the required service for pre term infants
Provide the required service for all histopathology and bacteriology results
Provide the emergency access that patients require
Provide the required clinical care for all birthing mothers
Mon – Fri 1hour each morning and 1.5 hours each evening. Sat and Sun 3 hours each evening.
On call service for deep clean as required.
Biomedical engineering provide a service in hours and out of hours via an on call system that will respond to any requests to maintain and repair equipment which is current and in use.
Estates and facilities are on call to respond to any repairs and maintenance to the theatre build and decoration.
Provide the materials that are used in the operating theatres. All consumables required for a surgical procedure (swabs, sutures suction etc).
Provide the necessary vehicles to transport all products required by theatre, to include the necessary patient transport. This is a  hour service.
Maternity Theatres are located at Broomfield Hospital, Level 4.
All Theatre staff required to support this service have access to maternity theatres
This must be via swiped card access
All patients and visitors have to report to the main reception to gain access to the Maternity Unit
All emergency patients gain access to maternity via the midwife on duty
The service will be delivered in accordance with and compliance to the Trust's Manual Handing Policies.

The service will be compliant with the Trust's Fire Safety Policy, Fire Evacuation Policy and other local fire plans and procedures.” (The detail of these items will then be developed as part of the separate Fire Safety Work Programme, as led by the Trust's Fire Officer.)
Telephones are provided in all areas. Should the phone lines fail there are mobile phones available from switchboard.
Computer access to include Scan track.
All patient information is stored via the computer system Theatre man and Bluespier
Accurate data is available re the patients' time in and out of the theatre area, the operative procedure
All equipment used is identified via scantrack and allocated to the patient.
All patients X-Rays can be accessed in theatre
All patients details can be accessed via Lorenzo system
Mandatory training is essential and in accordance with the Trusts requirements. In addition to this all theatre staff receive specialist training to support their job
description and this is compliant with the Trusts requirements to provide skilled staff
to deliver the patient care required. The theatre team will participate in maternity multidisciplinary training (PROMPT training).
Male and female changing rooms with lockers
On call room for Anaesthetic support
General Pharmacy requirements are supplied to the theatre dept using a general top up system.
All controlled drugs are ordered as per theatre requirements and these are stored in a controlled drug locked cupboard in accordance with Trust policy.
All other generic anaesthetic and operating equipment
The service will be delivered in accordance with and compliance to the Trust's Infection Prevention Policies.
The Trust is committed to commit to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals.
The service may be compromised if more than one maternity emergency occurs. In this event the contingency plan will be implemented. The Consultant Anaesthetist
will be consulted re the Case priority. The on call teams are contactable by an on
The theatre service will supply another team to respond to another emergency and the Consultant Anaesthetist will decide how this will be managed.
Another team will be made available from the main Theatre team.
In the event of further services being required the manager/Matron for the service will be contacted.
Please refer to Appendix B for the MSE Organogram.

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved locally by the Maternity and Gynaecology Practice Steering Group prior to submission to the Controlled Document team for ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.

It is the Guidelines and Audit Nurse's and author's responsibility to inform the Maternity and Gynaecology Practice Steering Group and appropriate Maternity Services' staff of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Taylor, S (2016) Standards and Recommendations for Safe Perioperative Practice 2016. National Association of Theatre Nurses
The Association of Perioperative Practitioners. Recommendations for Safe Staffing Levels for Theatres.
